TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1374
TEI.2.document_title: WIlliam Laughlin to Stephen F. Austin, 07-17-1826

barker_notes.barker_summary: William Laughlin to Austin, July 17, 1826. Judicial procedure.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1374

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*William Laughlin to Austin, July 17, 1826. Judicial procedure.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Harrisburgh */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="07-17-1826">July 17th, 1826*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Coln Austin*/person_mentioned**/p* *p*Sir*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*John Kenney*/person_mentioned* presented me with an order from you threw his Petition directing me to take*person_mentioned* S. C Hirams*/person_mentioned* as bail on the order of atatchmentt against him in favour of *person_mentioned*Taylor */person_mentioned*warein your Honer directed a bond in the sum of ten hundred dollars wich *person_mentioned*Hiram*/person_mentioned*s Refused houghever after pestering me a day or tew I recived a sorte of Bond for delivery of the Property altho not sattisfactory I delivered up the Property in my Poseson *person_mentioned*Mr. Taylor*/person_mentioned* not being satisfied Refused to deliver tew Cows and Calves which he had Promised to him some time since on account of *person_mentioned*Mr Bayles*/person_mentioned* that he would not deliver until he had got- his Pay then insude som hard wordes betwixt the *person_mentioned*Partys */person_mentioned*in wich *person_mentioned*Kenney */person_mentioned*adresing him self to *person_mentioned*Mrs Taylor*/person_mentioned* cald her a damned old ------ware uppon *person_mentioned*Taylor */person_mentioned*seised his gun and swore he would shute him *person_mentioned*Kenney */person_mentioned*fled and thus Ended the Tragedy *person_mentioned*Kenney */person_mentioned*then in a bussel determined to seake Redress by a second application to your Honor Presentes me with a certificate stating sircumstances Reilitive to the proceding and lest it shoul not contain all and he mis Reppresent sircumstances I take this method to state to your Honor the facts yours humbel servant*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Wm. Laughlin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Col S F Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
